pr_title: pass executed Runnables through AbstractExecutorService.newTaskFor to get free context propagation

timeline.message: wrap executed Runnables in FutureTask to get free context-propagation

timeline.author: bantonsson

timeline.bodyText: Returning the favor, this looks like the same pattern that you suggested ClassValue for
timeline.author: devinsba

replies.bodyText: It's a bit different because we don't know how many distinct types of Runnable an executor will see - in clojure this could be every loaded class - whereas the other case was a library type with (I believe) relatively few implementations. In any case, this is temporary, because I will start work on a slick-specific instrumentation soon.
replies.author: richardstartin

timeline.bodyText: getDeclaredMethod and setAccessible can also throw SecurityException so I'd include that in the catch
timeline.author: mcculls

timeline.bodyText: I'm having a hard time understanding when to use Method and when to use Method Handles.  Why use one over the other?
timeline.author: tylerbenson

replies.bodyText: Ah, I think I get it... Here you must use reflection because newTaskFor is not accessible, so you can't use Method Handles or call it directly.
replies.author: tylerbenson

replies.bodyText: Yes, exactly. We could unreflect the method to get a MethodHandle, but then we need to use invokeWithArguments and would have no benefit over just using reflection.
replies.author: richardstartin

timeline.bodyText: I think a class comment describing the benefits of this approach would be useful for posterity.
timeline.author: tylerbenson

timeline.bodyText:
In the future, it might be possible to replace this with a direct method call:
raphw/byte-buddy#484
Meanwhile, you may be able to avoid the reflection with MemberSubstitution raphw/byte-buddy#483
timeline.author: tylerbenson

replies.bodyText: I will look into using MemberSubstitution here, but we'd need reorganise things a bit to be able to do it without action-at-a-distance dependencies, so I'll do it as part of a PR to make that possible in a sensible way.
replies.author: richardstartin
